Your key responsibilities

The Enterprise Intelligence (EI) team works collaboratively with our clients to manage engagements and lead teams of data analysis resources in all aspects of design and delivery of information solutions. The needs of our clients are driven by global trends such as big data, cloud computing, disparate data volumes and the increased complexity of data structures. You will support in the implementation of solutions related to core EI competencies of Analytics, Business Intelligence, Enterprise Performance Management and Information Management. And also assist in the delivery of quality deliverables, working and communicating effectively with the engagement team and client’s team to ensure exceptional performance.

Qualifications

Skills and attributes for success

Good understanding of economic or market issues and the ability to interpret their impact on clients
Leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery and maintain our leading edge best practices
Strong presentation skills and proficiency in the use of PowerPoint, Word and Excel

To qualify for the role you must have

Minimum 6+ year’s data and analytics experience including business intelligence, data mining, modeling and using predictive analytics tools. (Including 4+ years of applicable FSO experience).
Master's degree in Math, Statistics, Actuarial or related field.
Requires very strong abilities in problem solving including managing data mining and cleansing, with broad knowledge of economics, optimization, machine learning and database science.
Strong knowledge of working with data mining tools such as R, SAS, SPSS
Prior experience working with data and analytics programs through lifecycle (gathering data, design, recommendations, testing, implementation, communication, revisions)
Strong analytics and problem-solving capabilities required, including advanced skills in statistical analysis.

Ideally, you’ll also have

Strong communication and business relationship skills to effectively explain analysis, both verbally and in writing, to others and translate analysis into a clear business plan
Strong time management and organizational skills to gather and make use of data (both internal and external).
Equal Employment Opportunity Information
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around

Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career

The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

Job Title: Digital Business Analyst / Programme Manager, Planning
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) of the Government Technology Agency (GovTech) strategises & delivers whole-of-government (WOG) infrastructure products and services. We are looking for a Business Analyst/ Programme Manager to support the Planning team of GIG.

The Programme Manager is responsible for managing the overall programme plans that support the whole-of-government ICT digitalisation transformation. This job role requires cross-team collaboration to monitor the status of all the programme tracks and provide regular updates to internal and external stakeholders. The Programme Manager is also in-charge of managing contracts for software licences and support the project teams on software licensing issues.

What to Expect:
Support the planning process, such as envisioning, formulation of the Group’s planning guidance, development, implementation and evaluation of the Group’s plans, goals, objectives, policies and procedures.

Support meetings, document and track follow up of action items.

Conduct / Compile surveys and polls

Oversee the procurement and management of Suppliers’ performance in meeting contractual obligations for outsourced planning or governance programmes / projects.

Collect and analyse data points to assess quality and operational effectiveness, and work with GIG Divisions to recommend effective improvements.

Provide secretariat support to GIG-internal as well as external committee meetings involving senior leadership, including setting agendas where necessary, collating and ensuring quality of GIG submissions (e.g. papers / presentations), meeting minutes etc.

Be the point of contact to stakeholders on all matters related to the programmes

Monitor the utilisation of funding and manpower requested and track the programme’s deliverables

Coordinate, consolidate and review deliverables from GIG Divisions for reporting or submissions in a variety of areas such as workplan, risks, quality, contracts, manpower, budget, expenditures, audits, operational effectiveness, measurements, etc.

Maintain registers (e.g. risk register, contract register, portfolios), monitor adherence by GIG Divisions to plans and schedules (e.g. internal and external quality audits, supplier conformance audits by GIG, external audits by AGOs etc), and coordinate status updates to Management Teams.

Manage the procurement of software licences (such as Microsoft and Oracle) for whole-of-government; Address queries and issues relating to software licences

Assist in managing workforce transformation and change management strategies of the group, to align with corporate workforce vision, including conduct of needs analysis, develop and implement competency framework and implementation plan (e.g. emplacement, training and development plans).

How to Succeed:
Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplines

Minimum 5 years of relevant planning and development work, project management or programme management role
Working experience in leading a team to support programmes either in an external IT service provider organisation or internal IT department within an organisation is an added advantage.
Experience working in cross-functional teams with strong communication and management skills
Experience in software product licensing is advantageous
Project management accreditation such as PMP, CITPM or equivalent, are preferred
Good Facilitation sills
Good communication skills – both written and verbal.
Problem solving and root cause identification skills.
Team player & good interpersonal skills.
Conversant in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint

About UOBUnited Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the DepartmentThe Global Market function leverages our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice, products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment managers, we manage our clients’ investment, liability and risk management needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes.
Job ResponsibilitiesThe candidate(s) will report into the Global Markets/Global Business Management/Product Support Department as part of the Global Markets Platform (GMP) implementation team and will primarily be responsible for new product implementation, maintenance and daily Business-As-Usual support of Global Markets front office risk systems. His / Her responsibilities include:

Working with front office traders to understand the business needs for trading, including derivatives payoff variations, product specifications, risk reports, trade-related reports etc
Translating new front office requirements into proper Business Requirements Documents
Working with Technology to participate in system design, user acceptance test, troubleshooting and ensuring that new front office system needs are being met in any implementation.
Provide presentation and knowledge sharing to all downstream users for new product rollouts
Working with Operations, Risk and Finance divisions to create a seamless end-to-end process covering all aspects of the trade life cycle
Regular communications with front office on implementation activities that requires their attention
Investigate and deduce issues raised by FO relating to trading systems, product payoff variations, PnL distortion, risk variations, trade life cycle and work process
Collaborate with vendor to resolve system issues, making sure all issues are addressed effectively and timely
Provide training on the proper use of Global Markets Platforms
Actively manage all user queries on functional, system or processes, and ensuring that all cases are logged, closed or worked upon appropriately on a daily basis.
Process documentation
Products under support includes Foreign Exchange, Money Market and Interest Rate derivatives

Job Requirements
A Bachelor or Master degree in Applied Finance, Computational Finance, Computer Science, Technology and relevant discipline from reputable institutions
A minimum of at least 2 years’ work experience in front office support or middle office role
Knowledge of Treasury products in particular FX, FX Derivatives, IR Derivatives and money market products
Knowledge of Treasury applications in particular Murex is a major advantage
Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Strong presentation and meeting skills
Good programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL+, Java, or any others
Good Design Thinking skills
Proactive and has initiative to thrive in a fast-paced environment to deliver and meet deadlines
Highly resourceful, self-motivated and conscientious with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good user relationship management

End-user focused and empathy

We manage the risks arising from the Group’s business activities within the risk appetite established by the Board. This involves identifying and evaluating the risks, developing effective risk governance and strategies as well as providing independent assessment of the overall risk profile.Job ResponsibilitiesThe Role

The role is based in Singapore and will be part of a team of over 40 analysts supporting Personal Financial Services (PFS), Business Banking (BB) and Private Banking (PB) business segments in Singapore and regionally.

Responsibilities

Identify, initiate and lead data science / advanced analytics projects in the area of sales, marketing, CRM / customer engagement, risk, compliance and operational efficiency.
Leverage big data, machine learning and new technologies (voice, video, NLP, chatbot, etc) to support PFS, BB and PB management in achieving business KPIs – increase revenue (acquisition, advisory, cross-sell, attrition, pricing, etc), enhance customer engagement (sentiment analysis, call-centre, recommender engine, NPS, etc), reduce losses (alternative credit scoring, fraud, etc) and improve operational efficiency / effectiveness (optimization, RPA, OCR, visualization tools, etc)
Acquire, process and monetize internal and external data. This includes proactively sourcing for and working with external partners (fintechs, data providers, commercial entities and government agencies, etc)
Support end-to-end operationalization of analytic models. This includes generating requirements, testing and working with internal technology teams and external vendors
Continuously engage business managers and build relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Must be able to present / communicate complex concepts in simple terms / language, and translate data and models into actionable business insights

Job Requirements
Relevant degree in Statistics / Computer Science, etc. MBA / post graduate degree is highly desired
More than 5 years of practical / commercial data science experience in a financial institution, fintech or other similar organizations. Must be equally comfortable in doing hands-on work as well as leading teams / junior colleagues
Extensive experience in Python, R and Scala on Hadoop / Spark big data pipeline (specifically, Cloudera platform for data engineering and data science). SAS and SQL experience also very useful. Cloud (AWS, Google, Azure) certification / experience is a bonus.
Analytical mind with sound business insight, excellent communicator (verbal and written), highly meticulous, and self-motivated
Maturity that will enable the candidate to be a credible counterpart to business managers and senior management, and the ability to develop on-going ‘trusted advisor’ relationships based on the ability to understand, analyse, discuss and address key business challenges raised

Company:

United Overseas Bank Limited

About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
Job Description:

Drive Requirements Lifecycle - From abstract product vision all the way to detailed functional requirements and business processes required to support them.
Bridge Product Owners and Developers - Translate the high-level product vision and initiatives into tangible, detailed requirements for developers. This can be in the form of process flows, or functional specifications.
Support Product Owners - Prioritise requirements by assessing and documenting their impact and costs to the business. Help the Product Owners manage the product backlog by providing input, and justifying prioritisation.
Support Development and Testing - Support developers and testers by providing the first level of functional clarifications during development, and prepare UAT test cases for testing phase.
Key responsibilities include:

Define detailed user stories based on business requirements, ensuring that they follow UOB’s prescribed format. Ensure that user stories have sufficient details so that developers are able to estimate and work with them.
Define detailed business processes, spanning both online and offline aspects. Coordinate with various stakeholders in UOB to get detailed requirements, and ensure that they are met through proposed solution.
Ensure user stories are consistent and high-quality.
Actively participate in Sprint Planning meetings between Product Owner and squad members to explain the story requirements.
Actively participate in Sprint Estimation meetings to explain the story’s requirement.
Work with the design team for requirements that require User Interface Design.
Consult Solution Architect or System Analyst for technical requirements.
Compile final requirements documentation on Confluence.
Be available for Product Owner to discuss any dependencies or backlog topic. Assist the Product Owner in defining finer details of the product.
Manage UAT preparations (e.g. test cases)
Assess operational impact and ensure affected areas embed in operational readiness plan
Job Requirements
Skills Required:
Good understanding of digital banking products and processes, and retail banking.
Extremely detail oriented.
Ability to translate high-level requirements into detailed documentation within the organisation’s context.
Ability to evaluate and analyse existing business processes, and uncover areas for improvements.
Ability to envision and design end to end business processes keeping an eye on the details.
Ability to gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful documentation.
Ability to communicate and clarify requirements with developers.
Ability to identify and clearly document dependencies.
Excellent functional / documentation skills.

We're looking for a Business Analyst to work onsite within our Digital Venture office in Singapore. We're a very small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams.

As a Business Analyst you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high quality products for our customers.

Job Description
The Business Analyst is a key member of our Product Team and is responsible for business analysis and requirements gathering across one of our product and service propositions. You will be the glue in one of our multidisciplinary teams, helping to drive alignment across Product, Technology, Operations and Finance, adapting as our needs change and our organisation matures. You will lead by example in an approach that is based on Building, Learning and rapidly Adapting. Your ultimate success is critically dependent on your ability to guide your team and peers, while influencing decision makers to build trust and secure long-term buy-in.

The Role Responsibilities
Be the Business Analyst within a Product Team, driving alignment with other Product Teams as well as with Technology, Operations and Finance
Adopt and contribute to a coherent and uniform approach to business analysis, mapping processes into a single, consolidated repository
Understand end-to-end flows within our solution design, recognising and calling out up and down stream impacts
Federate and manage business analysis activities against the respective and aligned Technical and Operational Teams
Own the definition of quality for analysis output for Product Team’s delivery components
Assist in developing the economic model, business plan and operating model for new products and services
Assist in defining the commercial launch and go-to-market strategy
Assist with creating and articulating business cases and operating plans
Assist with creating proposals for new business opportunities
Define, manage and track budgets and work plans

Our Ideal Candidate:
5+ years of experience working in a team building large-scale digital services within a high growth and rapidly changing environment, with 3+ years gathering and defining requirements for digital product development and complex (partner) system integration projects A degree in a technical discipline (information systems, computer science, electrical engineering etc)
Practical experience in agile/SCRUM methodologies alike
Strong finance industry and digital technology and business analysis functional knowledge
Proficiency in the usage of the underpinning frameworks and tools for business analysis documentation such as Confluence, Jira etc
Experience and knowledge to guide and inform Technology to ensure all aspects of requirements are considered in Technical Design
Experience maintaining confidentiality without creating barriers to success in a fast-paced, intellectually demanding and service-oriented environment
Exceptional attention to detail and strong technical intuition
The ability to manage time and schedules to meet aggressive deadlines and influence through persuasive written and verbal communication

Company Introduction

RIB Software SE is the global leader of digital transformation for building and construction industries, providing the most cutting edge software technologies and innovative working methods to increase industry productivity. RIB endeavours to be the best partner of building and construction enterprises for digitalization and transformation. Our iTWO solution is an eco-system that helps digitalize enterprises in the building and construction industries. The flagship iTWO 4.0 platform integrates 3D BIM models with project schedule (4th D) and cost (5th D) for design-to-delivery management, realizing end-to-end digital planning and physical construction in one cloud-based integrated platform, creating maximum business value. With offices in over 30 countries, 1000 employees and over 15,000 clients, RIB is regarded as the benchmark for construction technology.

Project Introduction

iTWO 5D Lab is an iTWO technology- enabled environment where customers can visit and experience using iTWO technology with real projects. The lab simulates a real working environment of a company with decision making table and function supporting workstations representing each functional department of a company. The customers can have real experience of using the cutting edge iTWO technology with standard project templates, as well as bring their own project data.

Due to the vigorous development of digital technology and change of working style these days, we are going to set up an Analytic LAB in Singapore to pool the resources together and prepare together since all work could be done remotely and virtual. In this way, we can mobilize the knowledge of our subject matter experts best possible. Thus we are looking for some talented Business Analysts good at IT to support global business by checking if tasks are executed as planned and evaluating the status of our developments. The ideal candidates will be part of a dynamic, global team and will play a crucial role in helping achieve the company’s objectives.

Requirements
Work closely with global R&D, business teams and programs to ensure the platform could go live in 48 hours, meanwhile meet client’s requirement.
Create easy-to-consume dashboards of key metrics; monitor and share insights at a frequent cadence
Visualize data to communicate performance and impact of various product changes
Work with colleagues to translate broad business goals into testable hypotheses and actionable recommendations
Serve as an internal IT consultant for the Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Support teams.
Experience:

· Bachelor’s degree in information technology, machine learning, Data Analytics, Statistics or other related disciplines, MBA or Master will be a plus.

· Strong ability in self-motivated and high responsibility for daily work. Proven ability to work in a team environment and multi-task to produce quality client deliverables

· Strong IT skills – has ability to solve technical problems and analyst clients’ need in IT aspects.

· Excellent presentation, communication skills

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

· Willing to work a flexible schedule

RIB endeavours to be the best partner of building and construction enterprises for digitalization and transformation. Our iTWO solution is an eco-system that helps digitalize enterprises in the building and construction industries. The flagship iTWO 4.0 platform integrates 3D BIM models with project schedule (4th D) and cost (5th D) for design-to-delivery management, realizing end-to-end digital planning and physical construction in one cloud-based integrated platform, creating maximum business value. With offices in over 30 countries, 1000 employees and over 15,000 clients, RIB is regarded as the benchmark for construction technology.

Project Introduction

iTWO 5D Lab is an iTWO technology- enabled environment where customers can visit and experience using iTWO technology with real projects. The lab simulates a real working environment of a company with decision making table and function supporting workstations representing each functional department of a company. The customers can have real experience of using the cutting edge iTWO technology with standard project templates, as well as bring their own project data.

Due to the vigorous development of digital technology and change of working style these days, we are going to set up an Analytic LAB in Singapore to pool the resources together and prepare together since all work could be done remotely and virtual. In this way, we can mobilize the knowledge of our subject matter experts best possible. Thus we are looking for some talented Business Analysts good at BIM and construction to support the global clients by checking if tasks are executed as planned and evaluating the status of our developments. The ideal candidates will be part of a dynamic, global team and will play a crucial role in helping achieve the company’s objectives.

Requirements
Work closely with global R&D, consulting, marketing teams and programs to analyze business requirement, program process and define the construction process for clients.
Create easy-to-consume dashboards of key metrics; monitor and share insights at a frequent cadence
Familiar with BIM and good at construction process management, good at prefabricated solution is big advantage.
Visualize data to communicate performance and impact of various product changes
Translate broad business goals into testable hypotheses and actionable recommendations
Serve as an internal consultant for the Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Support teams for all things data and analytics
Experience:
Bachelor in Civil Engineering, Construction, or other related disciplines. MBA or Master degree will be a plus.
Strong ability in self-motivated and high responsibility for daily work. Proven ability to work in a team environment and multi-task to produce quality client deliverables.
Strong analytical skills – has ability to ask right questions, analyze data, draws conclusion by making appropriate assumptions.
Excellent presentation, communication skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Willing to work a flexible schedule.

Job Title: Manager/Assistant VP, Business Analyst (FX & IR Derivatives)
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Global Market function leverages our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice, products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment managers, we manage our clients’ investment, liability and risk management needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes.

Job Responsibilities

The candidate(s) will report into the Global Markets/Global Business Management/Product Support Department as part of the Global Markets Platform (GMP) implementation team and will primarily be responsible for new product implementation, maintenance and daily Business-As-Usual support of Global Markets front office risk systems. His / Her responsibilities include:

Working with front office traders to understand the business needs for trading, including derivatives payoff variations, product specifications, risk reports, trade-related reports etc
Translating new front office requirements into proper Business Requirements Documents
Working with Technology to participate in system design, user acceptance test, troubleshooting and ensuring that new front office system needs are being met in any implementation.
Provide presentation and knowledge sharing to all downstream users for new product rollouts
Working with Operations, Risk and Finance divisions to create a seamless end-to-end process covering all aspects of the trade life cycle
Regular communications with front office on implementation activities that requires their attention
Investigate and deduce issues raised by FO relating to trading systems, product payoff variations, PnL distortion, risk variations, trade life cycle and work process
Collaborate with vendor to resolve system issues, making sure all issues are addressed effectively and timely
Provide training on the proper use of Global Markets Platforms
Actively manage all user queries on functional, system or processes, and ensuring that all cases are logged, closed or worked upon appropriately on a daily basis.
Process documentation
Products under support includes Foreign Exchange, Money Market and Interest Rate derivatives
Job Requirements
A Bachelor or Master degree in Applied Finance, Computational Finance, Computer Science, Technology and relevant discipline from reputable institutions
A minimum of at least 2 years’ work experience in front office support or middle office role
Knowledge of Treasury products in particular FX, FX Derivatives, IR Derivatives and money market products
Knowledge of Treasury applications in particular Murex is a major advantage
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong presentation and meeting skills
Good programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL+, Java, or any others
Good Design Thinking skills
Proactive and has initiative to thrive in a fast-paced environment to deliver and meet deadlines
Highly resourceful, self-motivated and conscientious with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good user relationship management
End-user focused and empathy
Be a part of UOB Family

Apply now and make a difference.

Analyse source data and provide inputs on Data Modelling and Design
Provide inputs on source data extraction criteria
Involve in data profiling, data quality, meta data management
Provide rules for standardization across source systems
Write and execute SIT test cases and test scripts. Work Experience

At least 7 to 8 years of experience as a business analyst involved in Data Warehouse project, ideally for a Bank or an Insurance company.
Ability to write complex SQL scripts, test cases and perform SIT.
Candidates with experience in financial data models such as Insurance Information Warehouse (IIW) are preferred.

Have to gather and document data requirements from business users. Liaise with source system SMEs to understand the business logics of the data and translate them into Source to Target Data Mapping document.

Formative Search is working with an international energy technology company with its headquarter in France. Our client offers an intelligence platform coupled with human expertise to identify energy efficiency potentials in the industry. These potentials can give lead to medium / long-term projects or be used for automatic optimisations whether being linked to energy markets or through control-command.

Their mission insists in reshaping the way energy data is used to optimize the energy performance of manufacturers and to improve industrial processes and turn energy into a profit centre and their data science algorithms.

Since 2016, the company has grown significantly, acquiring many new customers and expanding in different countries in Europe and on the American and Asian continents. They are urgently looking for a Data Scientist, who will get involved in innovative projects, the mission is aimed to be the internal Data Science referent for the entire APAC area and to support project managers on analysis, modelling, and optimization for their many customers.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Stealth Travel Venture
Job Description:
BCG Digital Ventures is an ever-growing global team of entrepreneurs, designers, engineers, venture architects, product experts and investors. We invent, build, and invest in startups with the world’s most influential companies. The business ventures we create build strategic advantages for some of the most important global companies and help them own the next horizon of innovation.

About this opportunity:
We are getting ready to launch and scale a stealth travel tech startup that uses machine learning to power personalised discovery, planning and booking of experiences and activities. Financially backed by one of the largest global travel brands, this venture is well-positioned to disrupt the $250 Billion APAC travel experiences industry. The company is currently in pre-launch and is expected to enter the market early-2020.

We're looking for motivated senior data scientists to join our journey. As one of our first engineering hires, you will be responsible for using your technical expertise to help shape the product from an early stage and implement core features of the platform.

This is an opportunity to work in a team with other senior engineers, designers, and product managers who deliver high-quality software.

If you like true agile development – failing fast and iterating quickly, making data-driven decisions, and building software with the user always in mind – then we would love to hear from you! We are looking for data scientists who love to work as an integrated part of the engineering team, who are interested in not only developing models but also writing production-ready code to make use of the models and algorithms they develop.

Required experience:
We're currently using Python and deploying to AWS Sagemaker, but if you have the following experience, we think you'd be a great fit:
5+ years of commercial experience in industry as a Data Scientist
Strong and solid analytics foundations such as probability, statistics, ML/DL algorithms and data visualization
High level of proficiency in Python and able to produce production-ready code
Commercial experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP), and/or Recommendation systems
Trackable record of building successful ML/AI based products
Knowledge of database and SQL
Knowledge in one of the cloud services (AWS, GCP and Azure)
Strong communication skills to make complex ML/AI concepts understandable to different streams in the team

Preferred experience:
Masters Degree or above with research experience in ML/AI
Deep knowledge in Deep learning tools and platforms
Deep knowledge in Graph database
Good understanding of Agile methodology in software development

About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
Job Description:

Drive Requirements Lifecycle - From abstract product vision all the way to detailed functional requirements and business processes required to support them.
Bridge Product Owners and Developers - Translate the high-level product vision and initiatives into tangible, detailed requirements for developers. This can be in the form of process flows, or functional specifications.
Support Product Owners - Prioritise requirements by assessing and documenting their impact and costs to the business. Help the Product Owners manage the product backlog by providing input, and justifying prioritisation.
Support Development and Testing - Support developers and testers by providing the first level of functional clarifications during development, and prepare UAT test cases for testing phase.
Key responsibilities include:

Define detailed user stories based on business requirements, ensuring that they follow UOB’s prescribed format. Ensure that user stories have sufficient details so that developers are able to estimate and work with them.
Define detailed business processes, spanning both online and offline aspects. Coordinate with various stakeholders in UOB to get detailed requirements, and ensure that they are met through proposed solution.
Ensure user stories are consistent and high-quality.
Actively participate in Sprint Planning meetings between Product Owner and squad members to explain the story requirements.
Actively participate in Sprint Estimation meetings to explain the story’s requirement.
Work with the design team for requirements that require User Interface Design.
Consult Solution Architect or System Analyst for technical requirements.
Compile final requirements documentation on Confluence.
Be available for Product Owner to discuss any dependencies or backlog topic. Assist the Product Owner in defining finer details of the product.
Manage UAT preparations (e.g. test cases)
Assess operational impact and ensure affected areas embed in operational readiness plan
Job Requirements
Skills Required:
Good understanding of digital banking products and processes, and retail banking.
Extremely detail oriented.
Ability to translate high-level requirements into detailed documentation within the organisation’s context.
Ability to evaluate and analyse existing business processes, and uncover areas for improvements.
Ability to envision and design end to end business processes keeping an eye on the details.
Ability to gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful documentation.
Ability to communicate and clarify requirements with developers.
Ability to identify and clearly document dependencies.
Excellent functional / documentation skills.
Be a part of UOB Family
Apply now and make a difference.

Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-Singapore-Singapore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 05/May/2020
Unposting Date: Ongoing

We're looking for a Business Analyst to work onsite within our Digital Venture office in Singapore. We're a very small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams.

As a Business Analyst you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high quality products for our customers.

Job Description
The Business Analyst is a key member of our Product Team and is responsible for business analysis and requirements gathering across one of our product and service propositions. You will be the glue in one of our multidisciplinary teams, helping to drive alignment across Product, Technology, Operations and Finance, adapting as our needs change and our organisation matures. You will lead by example in an approach that is based on Building, Learning and rapidly Adapting. Your ultimate success is critically dependent on your ability to guide your team and peers, while influencing decision makers to build trust and secure long-term buy-in.

The Role Responsibilities
Be the Business Analyst within a Product Team, driving alignment with other Product Teams as well as with Technology, Operations and Finance
Adopt and contribute to a coherent and uniform approach to business analysis, mapping processes into a single, consolidated repository
Understand end-to-end flows within our solution design, recognising and calling out up and down stream impacts
Federate and manage business analysis activities against the respective and aligned Technical and Operational Teams
Own the definition of quality for analysis output for Product Team’s delivery components
Assist in developing the economic model, business plan and operating model for new products and services
Assist in defining the commercial launch and go-to-market strategy
Assist with creating and articulating business cases and operating plans
Assist with creating proposals for new business opportunities
Define, manage and track budgets and work plans

Our Ideal Candidate:
5+ years of experience working in a team building large-scale digital services within a high growth and rapidly changing environment, with 3+ years gathering and defining requirements for digital product development and complex (partner) system integration projects A degree in a technical discipline (information systems, computer science, electrical engineering etc)
Practical experience in agile/SCRUM methodologies alike
Strong finance industry and digital technology and business analysis functional knowledge
Proficiency in the usage of the underpinning frameworks and tools for business analysis documentation such as Confluence, Jira etc
Experience and knowledge to guide and inform Technology to ensure all aspects of requirements are considered in Technical Design
Experience maintaining confidentiality without creating barriers to success in a fast-paced, intellectually demanding and service-oriented environment
Exceptional attention to detail and strong technical intuition
The ability to manage time and schedules to meet aggressive deadlines and influence through persuasive written and verbal communication
Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages.

Job Description: Business Analyst/ Senior Business Analyst, Financial Planning Programme Office (Income Security Policy Division) - 1 Year Contract

Company Introduction

RIB Software SE is the global leader of digital transformation for building and construction industries, providing the most cutting edge software technologies and innovative working methods to increase industry productivity. RIB endeavours to be the best partner of building and construction enterprises for digitalization and transformation. Our iTWO solution is an eco-system that helps digitalize enterprises in the building and construction industries. The flagship iTWO 4.0 platform integrates 3D BIM models with project schedule (4th D) and cost (5th D) for design-to-delivery management, realizing end-to-end digital planning and physical construction in one cloud-based integrated platform, creating maximum business value. With offices in over 30 countries, 1000 employees and over 15,000 clients, RIB is regarded as the benchmark for construction technology.

Project Introduction

iTWO 5D Lab is an iTWO technology- enabled environment where customers can visit and experience using iTWO technology with real projects. The lab simulates a real working environment of a company with decision making table and function supporting workstations representing each functional department of a company. The customers can have real experience of using the cutting edge iTWO technology with standard project templates, as well as bring their own project data.

Due to the vigorous development of digital technology and change of working style these days, we are going to set up an Analytic LAB in Singapore to pool the resources together and prepare together since all work could be done remotely and virtual. In this way, we can mobilize the knowledge of our subject matter experts best possible. Thus we are looking for some talented Business Analysts good at IT to support global business by checking if tasks are executed as planned and evaluating the status of our developments. The ideal candidates will be part of a dynamic, global team and will play a crucial role in helping achieve the company’s objectives.

Requirements
Work closely with global R&D, business teams and programs to ensure the platform could go live in 48 hours, meanwhile meet client’s requirement.
Create easy-to-consume dashboards of key metrics; monitor and share insights at a frequent cadence
Visualize data to communicate performance and impact of various product changes
Work with colleagues to translate broad business goals into testable hypotheses and actionable recommendations
Serve as an internal IT consultant for the Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Support teams.
Experience:

· Bachelor’s degree in information technology, machine learning, Data Analytics, Statistics or other related disciplines, MBA or Master will be a plus.

· Strong ability in self-motivated and high responsibility for daily work. Proven ability to work in a team environment and multi-task to produce quality client deliverables

· Strong IT skills – has ability to solve technical problems and analyst clients’ need in IT aspects.

· Excellent presentation, communication skills

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

· Willing to work a flexible schedule

Job Title: Manager/Assistant VP, Business Analyst (FX & IR Derivatives)
Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Global Market function leverages our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice, products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment managers, we manage our clients’ investment, liability and risk management needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes.

Job Responsibilities

The candidate(s) will report into the Global Markets/Global Business Management/Product Support Department as part of the Global Markets Platform (GMP) implementation team and will primarily be responsible for new product implementation, maintenance and daily Business-As-Usual support of Global Markets front office risk systems. His / Her responsibilities include:

Working with front office traders to understand the business needs for trading, including derivatives payoff variations, product specifications, risk reports, trade-related reports etc
Translating new front office requirements into proper Business Requirements Documents
Working with Technology to participate in system design, user acceptance test, troubleshooting and ensuring that new front office system needs are being met in any implementation.
Provide presentation and knowledge sharing to all downstream users for new product rollouts
Working with Operations, Risk and Finance divisions to create a seamless end-to-end process covering all aspects of the trade life cycle
Regular communications with front office on implementation activities that requires their attention
Investigate and deduce issues raised by FO relating to trading systems, product payoff variations, PnL distortion, risk variations, trade life cycle and work process
Collaborate with vendor to resolve system issues, making sure all issues are addressed effectively and timely
Provide training on the proper use of Global Markets Platforms
Actively manage all user queries on functional, system or processes, and ensuring that all cases are logged, closed or worked upon appropriately on a daily basis.
Process documentation
Products under support includes Foreign Exchange, Money Market and Interest Rate derivatives
Job Requirements
A Bachelor or Master degree in Applied Finance, Computational Finance, Computer Science, Technology and relevant discipline from reputable institutions
A minimum of at least 2 years’ work experience in front office support or middle office role
Knowledge of Treasury products in particular FX, FX Derivatives, IR Derivatives and money market products
Knowledge of Treasury applications in particular Murex is a major advantage
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong presentation and meeting skills
Good programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL+, Java, or any others
Good Design Thinking skills
Proactive and has initiative to thrive in a fast-paced environment to deliver and meet deadlines
Highly resourceful, self-motivated and conscientious with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good user relationship management
End-user focused and empathy
Be a part of UOB Family

Apply now and make a difference.

Analyse source data and provide inputs on Data Modelling and Design
Provide inputs on source data extraction criteria
Involve in data profiling, data quality, meta data management
Provide rules for standardization across source systems
Write and execute SIT test cases and test scripts. Work Experience

At least 7 to 8 years of experience as a business analyst involved in Data Warehouse project, ideally for a Bank or an Insurance company.
Ability to write complex SQL scripts, test cases and perform SIT.

DATA SCIENTIST - ENERGY & DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES

Based in Singapore

Formative Search is working with an international energy technology company with its headquarter in France. Our client offers an intelligence platform coupled with human expertise to identify energy efficiency potentials in the industry. These potentials can give lead to medium / long-term projects or be used for automatic optimisations whether being linked to energy markets or through control-command.

Their mission insists in reshaping the way energy data is used to optimize the energy performance of manufacturers and to improve industrial processes and turn energy into a profit centre and their data science algorithms.

Since 2016, the company has grown significantly, acquiring many new customers and expanding in different countries in Europe and on the American and Asian continents. They are urgently looking for a Data Scientist, who will get involved in innovative projects, the mission is aimed to be the internal Data Science referent for the entire APAC area and to support project managers on analysis, modelling, and optimization for their many customers.

In partnership with an Operations Manager - Singapore and the Head of Data Science - France , this role will be required to participate in extremely varied projects where you will be able to be autonomous.

Roles & Responsibilities :
Participated in the creation and production of predictive models for customer needs
Carried out complex analyzes to highlight and exploit levers of energy optimization
Support project managers in their analyzes

You will be involved in Digitize Projects as a Lead IT Business Analyst throughout the entire life-cycle of the conceptualization and implementation. Good attitude and self-driven, able to plan and execute projects with minimal supervision.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Stealth Travel Venture
Job Description:
BCG Digital Ventures is an ever-growing global team of entrepreneurs, designers, engineers, venture architects, product experts and investors. We invent, build, and invest in startups with the world’s most influential companies. The business ventures we create build strategic advantages for some of the most important global companies and help them own the next horizon of innovation.

About this opportunity:
We are getting ready to launch and scale a stealth travel tech startup that uses machine learning to power personalised discovery, planning and booking of experiences and activities. Financially backed by one of the largest global travel brands, this venture is well-positioned to disrupt the $250 Billion APAC travel experiences industry. The company is currently in pre-launch and is expected to enter the market early-2020.

We're looking for motivated senior data scientists to join our journey. As one of our first engineering hires, you will be responsible for using your technical expertise to help shape the product from an early stage and implement core features of the platform.

This is an opportunity to work in a team with other senior engineers, designers, and product managers who deliver high-quality software.

If you like true agile development – failing fast and iterating quickly, making data-driven decisions, and building software with the user always in mind – then we would love to hear from you! We are looking for data scientists who love to work as an integrated part of the engineering team, who are interested in not only developing models but also writing production-ready code to make use of the models and algorithms they develop.

Required experience:
We're currently using Python and deploying to AWS Sagemaker, but if you have the following experience, we think you'd be a great fit:
5+ years of commercial experience in industry as a Data Scientist
Strong and solid analytics foundations such as probability, statistics, ML/DL algorithms and data visualization
High level of proficiency in Python and able to produce production-ready code
Commercial experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP), and/or Recommendation systems
Trackable record of building successful ML/AI based products
Knowledge of database and SQL
Knowledge in one of the cloud services (AWS, GCP and Azure)
Strong communication skills to make complex ML/AI concepts understandable to different streams in the team

Preferred experience:
Masters Degree or above with research experience in ML/AI
Deep knowledge in Deep learning tools and platforms
Deep knowledge in Graph database
Good understanding of Agile methodology in software development

05-May-2020

#job-location.job-location-inline {
display: inline;
}

Company:

United Overseas Bank Limited

About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
Job Description:

Drive Requirements Lifecycle - From abstract product vision all the way to detailed functional requirements and business processes required to support them.
Bridge Product Owners and Developers - Translate the high-level product vision and initiatives into tangible, detailed requirements for developers. This can be in the form of process flows, or functional specifications.
Support Product Owners - Prioritise requirements by assessing and documenting their impact and costs to the business. Help the Product Owners manage the product backlog by providing input, and justifying prioritisation.
Support Development and Testing - Support developers and testers by providing the first level of functional clarifications during development, and prepare UAT test cases for testing phase.
Key responsibilities include:

Define detailed user stories based on business requirements, ensuring that they follow UOB’s prescribed format. Ensure that user stories have sufficient details so that developers are able to estimate and work with them.
Define detailed business processes, spanning both online and offline aspects. Coordinate with various stakeholders in UOB to get detailed requirements, and ensure that they are met through proposed solution.
Ensure user stories are consistent and high-quality.
Actively participate in Sprint Planning meetings between Product Owner and squad members to explain the story requirements.
Actively participate in Sprint Estimation meetings to explain the story’s requirement.
Work with the design team for requirements that require User Interface Design.
Consult Solution Architect or System Analyst for technical requirements.
Compile final requirements documentation on Confluence.
Be available for Product Owner to discuss any dependencies or backlog topic. Assist the Product Owner in defining finer details of the product.
Manage UAT preparations (e.g. test cases)
Assess operational impact and ensure affected areas embed in operational readiness plan
Job Requirements
Skills Required:
Good understanding of digital banking products and processes, and retail banking.
Extremely detail oriented.
Ability to translate high-level requirements into detailed documentation within the organisation’s context.
Ability to evaluate and analyse existing business processes, and uncover areas for improvements.
Ability to envision and design end to end business processes keeping an eye on the details.
Ability to gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful documentation.
Ability to communicate and clarify requirements with developers.
Ability to identify and clearly document dependencies.
Excellent functional / documentation skills.
Be a part of UOB Family
Apply now and make a difference.

Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-Singapore-Singapore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 05/May/2020
Unposting Date: Ongoing

We're looking for a Business Analyst to work onsite within our Digital Venture office in Singapore. We're a very small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams.

As a Business Analyst you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high quality products for our customers.

Job Description
The Business Analyst is a key member of our Product Team and is responsible for business analysis and requirements gathering across one of our product and service propositions. You will be the glue in one of our multidisciplinary teams, helping to drive alignment across Product, Technology, Operations and Finance, adapting as our needs change and our organisation matures. You will lead by example in an approach that is based on Building, Learning and rapidly Adapting. Your ultimate success is critically dependent on your ability to guide your team and peers, while influencing decision makers to build trust and secure long-term buy-in.

The Role Responsibilities
Be the Business Analyst within a Product Team, driving alignment with other Product Teams as well as with Technology, Operations and Finance
Adopt and contribute to a coherent and uniform approach to business analysis, mapping processes into a single, consolidated repository
Understand end-to-end flows within our solution design, recognising and calling out up and down stream impacts
Federate and manage business analysis activities against the respective and aligned Technical and Operational Teams
Own the definition of quality for analysis output for Product Team’s delivery components
Assist in developing the economic model, business plan and operating model for new products and services
Assist in defining the commercial launch and go-to-market strategy
Assist with creating and articulating business cases and operating plans
Assist with creating proposals for new business opportunities
Define, manage and track budgets and work plans

Our Ideal Candidate:
5+ years of experience working in a team building large-scale digital services within a high growth and rapidly changing environment, with 3+ years gathering and defining requirements for digital product development and complex (partner) system integration projects A degree in a technical discipline (information systems, computer science, electrical engineering etc)
Practical experience in agile/SCRUM methodologies alike
Strong finance industry and digital technology and business analysis functional knowledge
Proficiency in the usage of the underpinning frameworks and tools for business analysis documentation such as Confluence, Jira etc
Experience and knowledge to guide and inform Technology to ensure all aspects of requirements are considered in Technical Design
Experience maintaining confidentiality without creating barriers to success in a fast-paced, intellectually demanding and service-oriented environment
Exceptional attention to detail and strong technical intuition
The ability to manage time and schedules to meet aggressive deadlines and influence through persuasive written and verbal communication
Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Company Introduction

RIB Software SE is the global leader of digital transformation for building and construction industries, providing the most cutting edge software technologies and innovative working methods to increase industry productivity. RIB endeavours to be the best partner of building and construction enterprises for digitalization and transformation. Our iTWO solution is an eco-system that helps digitalize enterprises in the building and construction industries. The flagship iTWO 4.0 platform integrates 3D BIM models with project schedule (4th D) and cost (5th D) for design-to-delivery management, realizing end-to-end digital planning and physical construction in one cloud-based integrated platform, creating maximum business value. With offices in over 30 countries, 1000 employees and over 15,000 clients, RIB is regarded as the benchmark for construction technology.

Project Introduction

iTWO 5D Lab is an iTWO technology- enabled environment where customers can visit and experience using iTWO technology with real projects. The lab simulates a real working environment of a company with decision making table and function supporting workstations representing each functional department of a company. The customers can have real experience of using the cutting edge iTWO technology with standard project templates, as well as bring their own project data.

Due to the vigorous development of digital technology and change of working style these days, we are going to set up an Analytic LAB in Singapore to pool the resources together and prepare together since all work could be done remotely and virtual. In this way, we can mobilize the knowledge of our subject matter experts best possible. Thus we are looking for some talented Business Analysts good at IT to support global business by checking if tasks are executed as planned and evaluating the status of our developments. The ideal candidates will be part of a dynamic, global team and will play a crucial role in helping achieve the company’s objectives.

Requirements
Work closely with global R&D, business teams and programs to ensure the platform could go live in 48 hours, meanwhile meet client’s requirement.
Create easy-to-consume dashboards of key metrics; monitor and share insights at a frequent cadence
Visualize data to communicate performance and impact of various product changes
Work with colleagues to translate broad business goals into testable hypotheses and actionable recommendations
Serve as an internal IT consultant for the Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Support teams.
Experience:

· Bachelor’s degree in information technology, machine learning, Data Analytics, Statistics or other related disciplines, MBA or Master will be a plus.

· Strong ability in self-motivated and high responsibility for daily work. Proven ability to work in a team environment and multi-task to produce quality client deliverables

· Strong IT skills – has ability to solve technical problems and analyst clients’ need in IT aspects.

· Excellent presentation, communication skills

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

· Willing to work a flexible schedule

Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) of the Government Technology Agency (GovTech) strategises & delivers whole-of-government (WOG) infrastructure products and services. We are looking for a Business Analyst/ Programme Manager to support the Governance team of GIG.

Job Description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About the Department

The Global Market function leverages our in-depth knowledge of markets to provide timely financial advice, products and solutions to our clients. Together with our segment managers, we manage our clients’ investment, liability and risk management needs through a comprehensive suite of treasury products and services across multiple asset classes.

Job Responsibilities

The candidate(s) will report into the Global Markets/Global Business Management/Product Support Department as part of the Global Markets Platform (GMP) implementation team and will primarily be responsible for new product implementation, maintenance and daily Business-As-Usual support of Global Markets front office risk systems. His / Her responsibilities include:

Working with front office traders to understand the business needs for trading, including derivatives payoff variations, product specifications, risk reports, trade-related reports etc
Translating new front office requirements into proper Business Requirements Documents
Working with Technology to participate in system design, user acceptance test, troubleshooting and ensuring that new front office system needs are being met in any implementation.
Provide presentation and knowledge sharing to all downstream users for new product rollouts
Working with Operations, Risk and Finance divisions to create a seamless end-to-end process covering all aspects of the trade life cycle
Regular communications with front office on implementation activities that requires their attention
Investigate and deduce issues raised by FO relating to trading systems, product payoff variations, PnL distortion, risk variations, trade life cycle and work process
Collaborate with vendor to resolve system issues, making sure all issues are addressed effectively and timely
Provide training on the proper use of Global Markets Platforms
Actively manage all user queries on functional, system or processes, and ensuring that all cases are logged, closed or worked upon appropriately on a daily basis.
Process documentation
Products under support includes Foreign Exchange, Money Market and Interest Rate derivatives
Job Requirements
A Bachelor or Master degree in Applied Finance, Computational Finance, Computer Science, Technology and relevant discipline from reputable institutions
A minimum of at least 2 years’ work experience in front office support or middle office role
Knowledge of Treasury products in particular FX, FX Derivatives, IR Derivatives and money market products
Knowledge of Treasury applications in particular Murex is a major advantage
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong presentation and meeting skills
Good programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL+, Java, or any others

Proactive and has initiative to thrive in a fast-paced environment to deliver and meet deadlines
Highly resourceful, self-motivated and conscientious with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good user relationship management
End-user focused and empathy
Be a part of UOB Family

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Stealth Travel Venture
Job Description:
BCG Digital Ventures is an ever-growing global team of entrepreneurs, designers, engineers, venture architects, product experts and investors. We invent, build, and invest in startups with the world’s most influential companies. The business ventures we create build strategic advantages for some of the most important global companies and help them own the next horizon of innovation.

About this opportunity:
We are getting ready to launch and scale a stealth travel tech startup that uses machine learning to power personalised discovery, planning and booking of experiences and activities. Financially backed by one of the largest global travel brands, this venture is well-positioned to disrupt the $250 Billion APAC travel experiences industry. The company is currently in pre-launch and is expected to enter the market early-2020.

We're looking for motivated senior data scientists to join our journey. As one of our first engineering hires, you will be responsible for using your technical expertise to help shape the product from an early stage and implement core features of the platform.

This is an opportunity to work in a team with other senior engineers, designers, and product managers who deliver high-quality software.

If you like true agile development – failing fast and iterating quickly, making data-driven decisions, and building software with the user always in mind – then we would love to hear from you! We are looking for data scientists who love to work as an integrated part of the engineering team, who are interested in not only developing models but also writing production-ready code to make use of the models and algorithms they develop.

Required experience:
We're currently using Python and deploying to AWS Sagemaker, but if you have the following experience, we think you'd be a great fit:
5+ years of commercial experience in industry as a Data Scientist
Strong and solid analytics foundations such as probability, statistics, ML/DL algorithms and data visualization
High level of proficiency in Python and able to produce production-ready code
Commercial experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP), and/or Recommendation systems
Trackable record of building successful ML/AI based products
Knowledge of database and SQL
Knowledge in one of the cloud services (AWS, GCP and Azure)
Strong communication skills to make complex ML/AI concepts understandable to different streams in the team

Preferred experience:
Masters Degree or above with research experience in ML/AI
Deep knowledge in Deep learning tools and platforms
Deep knowledge in Graph database
Good understanding of Agile methodology in software development

About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
Job Description:

Drive Requirements Lifecycle - From abstract product vision all the way to detailed functional requirements and business processes required to support them.
Bridge Product Owners and Developers - Translate the high-level product vision and initiatives into tangible, detailed requirements for developers. This can be in the form of process flows, or functional specifications.
Support Product Owners - Prioritise requirements by assessing and documenting their impact and costs to the business. Help the Product Owners manage the product backlog by providing input, and justifying prioritisation.
Support Development and Testing - Support developers and testers by providing the first level of functional clarifications during development, and prepare UAT test cases for testing phase.
Key responsibilities include:

Define detailed user stories based on business requirements, ensuring that they follow UOB’s prescribed format. Ensure that user stories have sufficient details so that developers are able to estimate and work with them.
Define detailed business processes, spanning both online and offline aspects. Coordinate with various stakeholders in UOB to get detailed requirements, and ensure that they are met through proposed solution.
Ensure user stories are consistent and high-quality.
Actively participate in Sprint Planning meetings between Product Owner and squad members to explain the story requirements.
Actively participate in Sprint Estimation meetings to explain the story’s requirement.
Work with the design team for requirements that require User Interface Design.
Consult Solution Architect or System Analyst for technical requirements.
Compile final requirements documentation on Confluence.
Be available for Product Owner to discuss any dependencies or backlog topic. Assist the Product Owner in defining finer details of the product.
Manage UAT preparations (e.g. test cases)
Assess operational impact and ensure affected areas embed in operational readiness plan
Job Requirements
Skills Required:
Good understanding of digital banking products and processes, and retail banking.
Extremely detail oriented.
Ability to translate high-level requirements into detailed documentation within the organisation’s context.
Ability to evaluate and analyse existing business processes, and uncover areas for improvements.
Ability to envision and design end to end business processes keeping an eye on the details.
Ability to gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful documentation.
Ability to communicate and clarify requirements with developers.
Ability to identify and clearly document dependencies.
Excellent functional / documentation skills.
Be a part of UOB Family

Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-Singapore-Singapore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent

Unposting Date: Ongoing

We're looking for a Business Analyst to work onsite within our Digital Venture office in Singapore. We're a very small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams.

As a Business Analyst you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high quality products for our customers.

Job Description
The Business Analyst is a key member of our Product Team and is responsible for business analysis and requirements gathering across one of our product and service propositions. You will be the glue in one of our multidisciplinary teams, helping to drive alignment across Product, Technology, Operations and Finance, adapting as our needs change and our organisation matures. You will lead by example in an approach that is based on Building, Learning and rapidly Adapting. Your ultimate success is critically dependent on your ability to guide your team and peers, while influencing decision makers to build trust and secure long-term buy-in.

The Role Responsibilities
Be the Business Analyst within a Product Team, driving alignment with other Product Teams as well as with Technology, Operations and Finance
Adopt and contribute to a coherent and uniform approach to business analysis, mapping processes into a single, consolidated repository
Understand end-to-end flows within our solution design, recognising and calling out up and down stream impacts
Federate and manage business analysis activities against the respective and aligned Technical and Operational Teams
Own the definition of quality for analysis output for Product Team’s delivery components
Assist in developing the economic model, business plan and operating model for new products and services
Assist in defining the commercial launch and go-to-market strategy
